header_summary: ZmnSCPxj proposes using Scriptless Script BitVM to replace hashes and preimages with points and scalars, allowing for equivocating bit commitments. They also discuss simplifying the process further by eliminating the use of Tapleaves and using only Schnorr signatures. Jonas Nick's email discusses the absence of adaptor signatures in BIP 327 ("MuSig2") due to length and complexity constraints, but provides a link to a security proof sketch. Carla Kirk-Cohen explains SimLN, a tool for simulating random payment activity on lightning networks. Gijs van Dam and Tony Giorgio discuss the concept of decorrelated payments and its potential benefits. Vincenzo Palazzo acknowledges an error in a previous post and provides the correct link.

recent_posts.title: BitVM: Compute Anything on Bitcoin
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj suggests using Scriptless Script BitVM to replace hashes and preimages with points and scalars.
- They propose a method for equivocating bit commitments using a slashable fund and pubkey.
- ZmnSCPxj outlines creating logic gate commitments using public keys and MuSig, suggesting simplification by eliminating Tapleaves.

recent_posts.title: Actuarial System To Reduce Interactivity In N-of-N (N	> 2) Multiparticipant Offchain Mechanisms
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj analyzes the use of BitVM, concluding it cannot achieve the desired goal.
- Proposed solution involves a program to detect actuary cheating, but BitVM triggers dishonest execution.
- Changing the polarity of the logic to punish the actuary is not feasible.

recent_posts.title: Proposed BIP for MuSig2 PSBT Fields
recent_posts.summary:
- The absence of adaptor signatures in BIP 327 ("MuSig2") is discussed.
- Adaptor signatures were excluded due to complexity, and a separate BIP was proposed.
- Despite lack of specification, adaptor signatures were added for experimentation in the libsecp256k1-zkp module.

recent_posts.title: SimLN: Simulate active test networks
recent_posts.summary:
- SimLN is a tool that simulates random payment activity on test lightning networks.
- It allows for configuring specific payment flows and testing against "busy" networks.
- SimLN automates payment generation, saves time, and offers several benefits for testing applications.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:
- Gijs van Dam mentions a concept related to decorrelated payments to Tony Giorgio.
- The concept could aid with decorrelated payments on an amount analysis level.
- Gijs refers to the concept as a step up after PTLC's and additional timing analysis protections.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:

active_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
active_posts.summary:

- Proposed solutions include introducing a coordinator or partitioning balances among off-chain user subsets.
- To address the issue of equivocation, the author suggests implementing cut-through spends and efficient Taproot tree editing.

active_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
active_posts.summary:

- They propose the use of sidepools as a solution to manage funds without closing channels.
- Sidepools help maintain liquidity, preserve privacy, and mitigate liquidity fluctuations on the network.
